author: 刘云
title: 安徽全椒：积极培育新能源汽车配套产业 - 首页幻灯片 - 中工网
text:
近年来，安徽省滁州市全椒县抢抓新能源汽车产业发展的窗口期、机遇期，积极培育新能源汽车配套产业，产业链逐步完善，产业竞争力不断提升。截至2024年底，该县拥有新能源汽车相关产业链企业119家，逐步形成以氢能、动力电池、节能内燃机为主的新能源产业集群。
这是3月11日在安徽元隽氢能科技股份有限公司拍摄的氢燃料电池。新华社记者 杜宇 摄
3月11日，工人在滁州悦达实业有限公司查看生产完成的混动发动机缸体。新华社记者 杜宇 摄
3月11日，工人在安徽元隽氢能科技股份有限公司检测氢燃料电池。新华社记者 杜宇 摄
3月11日，工人在安徽元隽氢能科技股份有限公司质子交换膜生产线检查产品。新华社记者 杜宇 摄
3月11日，工人在滁州悦达实业有限公司检查混动发动机缸体。新华社记者 杜宇 摄
3月11日，工人在安徽元隽氢能科技股份有限公司质子交换膜生产线上工作。新华社记者 杜宇 摄

author: mobile@rds.ca ()
title: Vuelta : Urko Berrade remporte la 18e étape
text:
Vuelta : Berrade remporte la 18e étape, OConnor toujours au sommet
L'Espagnol Urko Berrade a remporté jeudi la 18e étape du Tour d'Espagne en s'imposant sur ses terres et en solitaire à Maeztu où l'Australien Ben O'Connor a conservé son maillot rouge de leader.
Le natif de Pampelune (26 ans) de l'équipe Kern Pharma l'a emporté avec quatre secondes d'avance sur le Suisse Mauro Schmid.
Dans un groupe de poursuivants loin de la tête de course, O'Connor, de la formation Décathlon-AG2R La Mondiale, a conservé la tête du classement général, avec toujours cinq secondes d'avance sur le Slovène Primoz Roglic et à la veille de la 19e étape dont l'arrivée sera jugée au sommet de l'Alto De Moncalvillo.
Berrade, qui a signé jeudi sa première victoire chez les professionnels, faisait partie d'un premier peloton d'une quarantaine de coureurs échappés dès les premiers kilomètres.
Le Navarrais, qui s'est montré le plus fort dans les dernières difficultés, a offert la troisième victoire d'étape à sa formation Kern Phama (invitée) sur ce Tour d'Espagne, après un doublé de son coéquipier Pablo Castrillo, victorieux sur la 12e et la prestigieuse 15e étape au sommet du Cuitu Negru.
«Pour notre petite équipe, cette Vuelta était très importante. C'est un rêve ce qu'il nous arrive», a commenté le vainqueur au micro de l'organisation.
Concernant la course «nous étions en nombre à l'avant. C'est moi qui ai attaqué. Je savais que je devais me méfier de Mauro Schmid qui semblait avoir de très bonnes jambes.»
La Français David Gaudu intègre le top-5 du classement général que quitte Mikel Landa. L'Espagnol, victime d'une défaillance jeudi, n'apparaît plus qu'à la dixième position, loin du podium qu'il ambitionnait au départ de la course il y a trois semaines à Lisbonne.
«Je n'avais pas de force dans les jambes. Je ne comprends pas pourquoi», a déclaré le leader de la formation Soudal-Quick Step qui a perdu près de trois minutes sur ses principaux concurrents.
Vendredi, l'arrivée en altitude au sommet de l'exigeant Alto de Moncalvillo (8,6 km à 6,9 %, avec un passage à 16%) laisse espérer une nouvelle confrontation entre les prétendants au maillot rouge.
Deux difficultés répertoriées seront au programme avec le Puerto de Pradilla (3e catégorie, 5,2 km à 4,8%) à mi-parcours avant l'arrivée au sommet de l'Alto de Moncavillo (1re catégorie, 8,6 km à 8,9%) après 173,5 km de course.
O'Connor y sera forcément en danger mais «chaque jour en rouge est un bonus en plus», a déclaré le coureur de Décathlon.
Classement de la 18e étape du Tour d'Espagne, disputée jeudi entre Vitoria-Gasteiz et Maeztu :
1. Urko Berrade (ESP/EKP) les 179,3 km en 4 h 00:52.
(moyenne: 44,8 km/h)
2. Mauro Schmid (SUI/JAY) à 4.
3. Pau Miquel (ESP/EKP) 4.

author: Eva Miller
title: Catastrophic Flooding Hits Universal Orlando Resort
text:
Orlando, Florida’s weather is known for its variability throughout the year. Situated in Central Florida, Orlando experiences a subtropical climate characterized by hot and humid summers with frequent afternoon showers and thunderstorms. This kind of weather was on full display at Universal Orlando Resort , one of the region’s most popular theme park resorts.
In an unprecedented turn of events, Universal Orlando Resort was struck by extreme flooding on Thursday, August 1, causing significant disruption and damage across the sprawling theme park. The unexpected deluge began this afternoon, quickly escalating from heavy rain to a full-blown flood, leading to widespread chaos throughout the park.
Related: Significant Portion of Universal Orlando Closed Down Without Warning
Heavy rain today may be causing watertight projection boxes to float in the Universal lagoon. Projectors for CineSational. pic.twitter.com/2nAfFCISIb
— bioreconstruct (@bioreconstruct) August 1, 2024
Scenes of Devastation Guests and staff at Universal Orlando Resort were met with a harrowing scene as rain showers transformed into torrential downpours . The park’s usually vibrant walkways and attractions were submerged under several inches of water, with some areas experiencing more intense flooding.
The floodwaters have caused significant disruptions to park operations. Several attractions and rides are temporarily closed as crews work to remove debris and assess structural impacts. Restaurants, shops, and entertainment venues have also been affected, leading to the suspension of many planned activities.
Update:
It got worse…we have flooding too https://t.co/bVjoJ6XVLh pic.twitter.com/MuKHACOXrt
— Ethan Hershaft (@EthanHershaft) August 1, 2024
As of now, Universal Orlando Resort has not commented on the flooding, and from its appearance, no major damage has been caused to the current parks or to the construction of Epic Universe, the resort’s upcoming theme park. The theme park is built to handle storms like this, so hopefully, with proper drainage, everything will recover smoothly.
Credit: Universal Weather Conditions and Future Forecast The severe weather conditions were caused by a sudden and intense weather system that impacted the central Florida region. This weather is shocking but not uncommon in the area , and many witnesses of flooding were unphased . This is not the first and not the last major rainstorm that will hit these theme parks this season.
As cleanup efforts continue, Universal Orlando Resort remains focused on addressing the immediate needs of guests and staff, with the hope of resuming normal operations in the near future. Visitors are advised to stay informed through official channels for updates on park status and safety information.
This post originally appeared on Disney Dining .

author: VNExplorer
title: Social Security number data breach: What we can VERIFY
text: On Aug. 14, an X post with over 8.5 million views claimed that the personal information of nearly every American, including Social Security numbers and physical addresses, may have been compromised in a recent data breach. “Every American’s Social Security number may have been stolen in a new major hack, with over 2.7 billion records allegedly compromised from National Public Data. The stolen information includes Social Security numbers and physical addresses,” the viral post said. Similar posts are also circulating online. Multiple readers, including Carol, have asked us whether their personal information is now at risk. Here’s what we can VERIFY. THE SOURCES [video_shortcode_youtube src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/27fWN0OUR4Y?rel=0"] Sign up for the VERIFY Fast Facts daily Newsletter! WHAT WE FOUND Initial reports of the alleged data breach stem from a class-action lawsuit filed in Florida in August. The lawsuit, which was filed by California resident Christopher Hofmann on Aug. 1, alleges that hackers gained access to the personal information of “billions of individuals” from National Public Data, a background check company based in Coral Springs, Florida. National Public Data scrapes data from public record databases, national and state databases, and court records, including nonpublic sources, according to Schubert Jonckheer & Kolbe LLP, a law firm investigating the breach. Schubert Jonckheer & Kolbe LLP says National Public Data then sells this private data to a wide range of organizations, including background check websites, investigators, app developers, and data resellers. “Because individuals did not affirmatively provide their private information to NPD, individuals may not even know that they have been affected,” Schubert Jonckheer & Kolbe LLP said. Hofmann claims his identity theft protection service notified him in late July that his personal information had been compromised by the “nationalpublicdata.com” breach. The lawsuit claims the exposed information includes Social Security numbers, past and current addresses, names, and information about parents and siblings. Cybersecurity experts warn that this is the type of sensitive data that could allow a scammer to take out a loan in your name or gain access to your banking information. Top Class Actions says at least two more class-action lawsuits have also been filed against National Public Data concerning the same data breach. Has National Public Data or SSA confirmed the breach? As of Aug. 15, National Public Data, the defendant in the lawsuit, has not confirmed the data breach and the company did not immediately respond to VERIFY’s request for comment. Meanwhile, a Social Security Administration (SSA) spokesperson said in an email that “recent reports related to a data breach are unrelated to the Social Security Administration’s internal systems and data, neither of which has been compromised.” It is unclear if National Public Data has alerted people whose information was compromised in the alleged breach, though Hofmann’s lawsuit claims the company had “still not provided any notice or warning” to him. Some states require companies to report data breaches to their attorneys general offices. However, information security company McAfee said on Aug. 14 that it had not found any filings related to the breach. Florida law requires companies to file notices of any data breach that impacts 500 or more Floridians. When did the alleged breach happen? The exact date of the data breach is unclear, but it is believed to have taken place sometime in or around April 2024, according to Hofmann’s lawsuit. The complaints allege that a cybercriminal group named USDoD gained access to National Public Data’s network and then published and sold its findings on the dark web. One of the lawsuits claims the breach was first reported on June 1, by VX-Underground, an international cybersecurity research group, according to Top Class Actions. Top Class Actions says VX-Underground claimed that the cybercriminal group “USDoD” was behind the attack and had posted the database containing 2.9 billion records for sale online for $3.5 million. VX-Underground also confirmed the authenticity of the data. VX-Underground says the stolen database includes 277.1 gigabytes of data, including names, address histories, relatives, and Social Security numbers dating back at least three decades, according to Schubert Jonckheer & Kolbe LLP. USDoD has no affiliation with the U.S. Department of Defense, which is commonly referred to by the acronym “DOD.” How can I protect myself? Although the data breach has not yet been confirmed by National Public Data, cybersecurity experts recommended that you freeze your credit if you suspect your Social Security number or other personal information has been compromised. It’s free to freeze your credit with the three major credit bureaus: Equifax, Experian and TransUnion, according to the U.S. Public Information Research Group (PIRG), a non-profit consumer watchdog. Freezing your credit can block bad actors from taking out a loan or opening a new credit card in your name. But PIRG warns to never freeze your credit in response to an unsolicited email or text claiming to be from one of the credit agencies because it could be a scam. The National Cybersecurity Alliance says freezing your credit will limit access to your credit reports, and you’ll have to remember to unfreeze your credit if you’re applying for a new credit card or mortgage. PIRG notes that freezing your credit does not directly increase or decrease your credit score. You can freeze your accounts with the three major credit bureaus by phone or online: You can also sign up for a tracking service that will alert you if your data appears on the dark web through services provided by companies like Norton and Google One. If you suspect you are a victim of identity theft, the Social Security Administration recommends: Contacting the Federal Trade Commission at www.idtheft.gov, or call 1-877-IDTHEFT (1-877-438-4338); TTY 1-866-653-4261, Filing a police report with the police department where the identity theft took place and keeping a copy of the police report as proof of the crime, Contacting the fraud unit of one of the three consumer reporting companies Reporting Social Security scams online at oig.ssa.gov [video_shortcode_youtube src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Wo0eLThcXwg?rel=0"]

author: Raul Celis
title: Jennifer Lopez estaría «molesta y decepcionada» tras solicitar el divorcio a Ben Affleck
text:
Desde que se confirmó el rumor más hablado por la farándula estadounidense, es decir la ruptura matrimonial entre Jennifer Lopez y Ben Affleck , muchos se han estado preguntando ¿cómo se encuentra la Diva del Bronx?, y es que desde que solicitó el divorcio con el actor estadounidense el pasado 20 de agosto, se le ha visto con menos frecuencia.
Mientras que a Ben Affleck se le ha captado últimamente feliz y sonriente junto a sus hijos, la intérprete de ‘ Atlas ‘ se ha mantenido alejada del foco público, como si no quisiera dejar ver su estado de ánimo. Recientemente, el reconocido medio People , citó las declaraciones que una supuesta fuente allegada a la artista le ha revelado en exclusiva.
« Ella está molesta y decepcionada. Esto la ha golpeado muy fuerte «, habría dicho el informante, añadiendo que, además, su estado de ánimo se estaría viendo afectado frecuentemente por tener que seguir pasando sus días y noches en el mismo lugar que, tiempo atrás, compartía con amor y cariño con el actor.
